pageProps.content:
Experience

Luangwa River Camp sits nestled under an ancient ebony grove on the banks of the Luangwa River in one of the last unspoilt wilderness areas in Africa: The South Luangwa National Park.
This game-rich area - called the Luangwa Wafwa - is filled with its oxbow lagoons, riverine woodlands & large plains - & is home to an abundance of game, including lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, giraffe, hippo & over 450 bird species.
Guests travelling to South Luangwa will be able to explore this pristine bush environment on foot while being accompanied by an expert guide.

Stay

Luangwa River Camp is small & intimate, with only 5 brick & thatch bush suites, each with an en-suite bathroom with a sunken bathtub looking out onto your private corner of Africa.
The bedroom & bathroom at each suite is a-fronted, with large sliding doors leading onto a wooden deck allowing great views onto the river.
At the main lodge area, you will find a dining room, bar & swimming pool where further relaxation can take place.

Activities

Walking safaris are the focus at Luangwa River Camp, although open 4x4 game drives are also offered for guests interested to go further afield or look for nocturnal animals with a spotlight.
Seasonable boating safaris will give guests front row seats to exploring the hippo-filled river with all its animal activity.

subfolders.title: Bilimungwe Bushcamp
subfolders.description: Bilimungwe Bushcamp enjoys an ideal location in the wild & unspoilt region of Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. This intimate & remote safari camp boasts an ideal setting on the shaded banks of the Luangwa River, with views over the wildlife-packed grassy floodplains – a nature lover’s paradise!

subfolders.title: Chamilandu Bushcamp
subfolders.description: Chamilandu Bushcamp enjoys an ideal location in the wild & unspoilt region of Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. This intimate & remote safari camp boasts an ideal setting on the shaded banks of the Luangwa River, with views over the wildlife-packed grassy floodplains – a nature lover’s paradise!

subfolders.title: Chichele Presidential Lodge
subfolders.description: Chichele Presidential Lodge - as the name suggests – is the former home of the Zambian President & sits on a hill with panoramic views over the river & South Luangwa valley. South Luangwa National Park - one of Zambia’s premier wildlife destinations - & is home to a variety of wildlife - including lion, elephant, leopard, wild dog, giraffe & wildebeest.

subfolders.title: Chikoko Tree Camp
subfolders.description: The secluded & seasonally operated Chikoko Tree Camp is situated on the banks of the Luangwa River, deep in the heart of South Luangwa’s northern region. There are no roads leading to Chikoko, allowing guests a true off-the-beaten-track wilderness experience.  The camp is ideal for adventure-lovers looking for a little bit of “rustic” Africa.

subfolders.title: Chikunto Safari Lodge
subfolders.description: Chikunto Safari Lodge enjoys a fantastic location amongst rolling plains, plateaus, riverbanks & miombo vegetation in Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. The lodge is renowned for its surviving wildlife species, providing breathtaking scenery & game viewing right from its sweeping terrace!

subfolders.title: Chindeni Bushcamp
subfolders.description: Chindeni Bushcamp is situated deep within the wildlife-rich South Luangwa National Park Zambia & offers guests an authentic safari experience. This intimate & remote safari camp boasts an ideal setting on the meandering Luangwa River, with views over a wildlife-packed lagoon where hippo, puku & other wildlife, like large herds of elephants, can be frequently spotted.

subfolders.title: Flatdogs Camp
subfolders.description: Flatdogs Camp is unique in every way!  Situated on the border of the South Luangwa National Park, one of the last great wildlife wonders of the world, the camp has been visited by wildlife enthusiasts since its creation in 1972. What makes the camp so unique, is that it caters for absolutely everyone!  Not only is the wildlife viewing in this part of Zambia spectacular, but they also offer a wide range of accommodation options to suit all budgets & tastes.

subfolders.title: Island Bush Camp
subfolders.description: Island Bush Camp boasts a spectacular location in a very remote, yet extremely game-rich area in the southern section of Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. Far away from crowds in a pristine wilderness environment, this seasonal camp is only open during the best wildlife months between May & November.

subfolders.title: Kafunta River Lodge
subfolders.description: The classic Kafunta River Lodge boasts a spectacular location at the edge of a floodplain overlooking the Luangwa River in Zambia’s premier wildlife park:  South Luangwa. The Luangwa River is - without a doubt- one of the best wildlife viewing areas in the iconic South Luangwa National Park.

subfolders.title: Kaingo Camp
subfolders.description: Kaingo Camp is nestled amongst shady trees on the banks of the beautiful Luangwa River & one of the few owner-run camps in South Luangwa National Park. This camp, with its friendly atmosphere & top-notch guiding, is perfect for wildlife enthusiasts of every calibre as well as families looking for a laid-back Zambian holiday.

subfolders.title: Kalamu Lagoon Camp
subfolders.description: Set on a permanent lagoon in South Luangwa National Park’s Luamfa Concession lies Kalamu Lagoon Camp. With a pristine location in this remote region of the park, Kalamu offers an abundance of wildlife & is one of the most incredible conservation areas in Africa.

subfolders.title: Kapamba Bushcamp
subfolders.description: With an ideal location on the scenic Kapamba River in Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park, Kapamba Bushcamp offers wild safari encounters in this unspoilt section of Zambia. The camp offers the ultimate romantic safari experience, with beautiful rooms, private plunge pools & the advantage of viewing wildlife from the privacy of your room – individually designed to boast gorgeous river views!

subfolders.title: Kuyenda Bushcamp
subfolders.description: Kuyenda Bushcamp is situated on the banks of the Manzi River in South Luangwa National Park.   This remote location in Zambia is home to an abundance of game, offering guests a wild & unspoilt safari experience.

subfolders.title: Lion Camp
subfolders.description: Lion Camp is a privately owned safari lodge with a prime location on the edge of an oxbow lagoon in the South Luangwa National Park. The lagoon attracts a wide variety of wildlife, including lion, leopard, wild dog, large herds of elephants & buffaloes as well as the highest concentration of hippos in Africa!

subfolders.title: Luangwa River Camp
subfolders.description: Luangwa River Camp sits nestled under an ancient ebony grove on the banks of the Luangwa River in one of the last unspoilt wilderness areas in Africa:  The South Luangwa National Park. This game-rich area - called the Luangwa Wafwa - is filled with its oxbow lagoons, riverine woodlands & large plains - & is home to an abundance of game, including lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, giraffe, hippo & over 450 bird species.

subfolders.title: Mfuwe Lodge
subfolders.description: The award-winning Mfuwe Lodge enjoys a prime location in Zambia’s game-rich Luangwa Valley in South Luangwa National Park. This unspoilt area is filled with its oxbow lagoons, riverine woodlands & large plains - & is home to an abundance of game, including lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo, giraffe, hippo & over 450 bird species.

subfolders.title: Nkwali Camp
subfolders.description: Nkwali Camp lies in a game-rich area of ebony woodland just outside the world-renowned South Luangwa National Park. This area offers some of the best game viewing in Zambia – including regular sightings of leopard, hippo & giraffe - & it is not uncommon to see elephants cross the river.

subfolders.title: Nsefu Camp
subfolders.description: Nsefu, the first Zambian photographic safari camp in the area is perched on a scenic bend on the Luangwa River in the remote Nsefu area of South Luangwa National Park. The camp is ideal for those looking to experience sensational game viewing as well as exceptional bird watching since its location offers the perfect blend between both.

subfolders.title: Puku Ridge Camp
subfolders.description: The luxurious Puku Ridge Camp boasts a spectacular location in the untamed wilderness of Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. This African-chic camp offers uninterrupted views of the seemingly endless savannah - where lions, leopard, elephants, giraffes, hyenas & buffalos roam – many of which are frequently spotted from the comfort of the viewing deck.

subfolders.title: Robin's House
subfolders.description: The exclusive Robin’s House enjoys a lovely setting on the banks of the Luangwa River in Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. With breathtaking views of the river, this private Zambia villa - previously the home of the owner, Robin Pope - is the ideal safari choice for families who want to reconnect at their own pace.

subfolders.title: Shawa Luangwa Camp
subfolders.description: Named after Wanderlust’s top 8 best professional guides, Jacob Shawa, Shawa Luangwa Camp overlooks the beautiful Luangwa River & was handpicked by Jacob Shawa as the ideal safari spot to explore one the park’s most untouched areas. South Luangwa National Park is part of the Luangwa Valley – a complex ecosystem that consists of dramatic seasonal changes, lush vegetation & prolific wildlife – the perfect recipe for guests to fall in love with the Zambian wilderness.

subfolders.title: Tafika Camp
subfolders.description: Located in the rugged & wild South Luangwa National Park in Zambia, Tafika Lodge (open from May to November), enjoys gorgeous views of the Luangwa River. Tafika is the perfect choice for adventurous families looking for a unique safari experience & fun-filled activities.

subfolders.title: Tena Tena
subfolders.description: Tena Tena is a tented camp set on the banks of the Luangwa River in the heart of Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park:  one of the last unspoilt wilderness areas in Africa! The South Luangwa National Park is Zambia’s premier wildlife destination & home to a wealth of African wildlife - including elephant, hippo, lion, leopard, wild dog, giraffe, wildebeest & 400 species of birds.

subfolders.title: Time + Tide Chinzombo
subfolders.description: Set in a private concession on the banks of a river, Time + Tide Chinzombo – Zambia’s most luxurious safari camp - offers direct access to the world-renowned South Luangwa National Park. South Luangwa is Zambia’s premier wildlife destination & home to a wealth of African wildlife - including elephant, hippo, lion, leopard, wild dog, giraffe, wildebeest & 400 species of birds.

subfolders.title: Time + Tide Kakuli
subfolders.description: Situated on the confluence of the Luwi & Luangwa Rivers in South Luangwa National Park, Time + Tide Kakuli offers superb wildlife viewing & a range of exciting activities. Here you will find one of the densest concentrations of game in Africa - including elephant, hippo, lion, leopard, wild dog, giraffe, wildebeest & 400 species of birds.

subfolders.title: Time + Tide Luwi
subfolders.description: With a prime location in the heart of South Luangwa National Park, Time + Tide Luwi is an authentic safari camp that offers exceptional wildlife encounters & fun-filled safari activities. Luwi Camp is named after the seasonal river that flows nearby between January & April.

subfolders.title: Time + Tide Mchenja
subfolders.description: Mchenja – the local name for ebony – is nestled into a shady ebony grove beside the beautiful Luangwa River in the world-renowned South Luangwa National Park. There are no other camps for miles around & it is here where you will find one of the densest concentrations of game in Africa - including elephant, hippo, lion, leopard, wild dog, giraffe, wildebeest & 400 species of birds.

subfolders.title: Time + Tide Nsolo
subfolders.description: Nsolo – named after the honeyguide bird – is built on a raised wooden platform along a bend in the seasonal Luwi River in the heart of Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. There are no other camps for miles around & it is here where you will find one of the densest concentrations of game in Africa - including elephant, hippo, lion, leopard, wild dog, giraffe, wildebeest & 400 striking & unusual bird species.

subfolders.title: Zungulila Bushcamp
subfolders.description: Zungulila Bushcamp boasts a beautiful setting overlooking the Kapamba River in Zambia’s South Luangwa National Park. The camp sits on a raised knoll above picturesque plains & natural springs – a magnet for attracting wildlife year-round.

whatWeLoveItems: Prime position in the unspoilt South Luangwa
